Description: Ostracon, fragment from the upper-body of a red-brown pottery storage-vessel, the fabric is relatively coarse and greyish in section, the exterior is decorated with polychrome painted - blue, yellow and red-brown - lotus-flower motifs and bands, a red-brown painted ankh-sign survives on the yellow band.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (393555) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/393555)
